Topic.Title: Overtyping when editing copied over text from Word

Posts.EditableText:
Hi,

I'm creating a non-linear version of my PhD Thesis, and need to copy over my whole thesis (chapter/sections at a time) so that the examiners can navigate themeselves through the text. However, when I copy the text over, and try to edit or add text so that it matches the format, it just overtypes, removing the original text as I go along.

Is there any setting I need to know about that could turn this off? Or is this a bug?

I don't really have the time to type up my whole thesis again.

EDIT: I've closed and re-opened and it seems to have sorted itself. But I'm still concerned that this happens.
Posts.HTML:
Hi,

I'm creating a non-linear version of my PhD Thesis, and need to copy over my whole thesis (chapter/sections at a time) so that the examiners can navigate themeselves through the text. However, when I copy the text over, and try to edit or add text so that it matches the format, it just overtypes, removing the original text as I go along.

Is there any setting I need to know about that could turn this off? Or is this a bug?

I don't really have the time to type up my whole thesis again.

EDIT: I've closed and re-opened and it seems to have sorted itself. But I'm still concerned that this happens.

Posts.EditableText: Have you tried making sure you've hit 'insert' on your keyboard? Does it over type in word?
Posts.HTML: Have you tried making sure you've hit 'insert' on your keyboard? Does it over type in word?
